I'm like a child in a pile of sweets. Eat one and I can't eat another, so I sit in a pile of sweets yelling for a sweetie. Think that, except videogames.

WoW...I never got into it.

But this is the one with the only remaining goodies I need
I'm trying to motivate myself to jump in and actually FACE the Dark souls combat. I don't really handle difficulty well.
I generally brute force everything.
It happened in Halo. I'd just brute force my way through, dying until I got to the next checkpoint. Speaking of which, ODST drops tomorrow...another Legendary Hell to jump feet first into...
Currently I'm trying to beat all of the Halo games in MCC on legendary. It's...frustrating.

A combination of my lack of skill, various factors weighing within each legendary, and my general impatience create a fustercluck of pain and anguish, punctuated by moments of happiness of finally beating a level.
Oh, and I am mostly going straight in to Legendary. As in, playing on the hardest difficulty first time.
Without any intermediates.

PC's got all the fun mods.  Chasethebro is an invasion-oriented DS3 youtuber whose friend created the "Honest Merchant" mod

It replaces a corpse near the tower gate in the Shrine with another corpse who is the "honest merchant".  By performing one of four gestures, you gain access to various items menus, where you can buy just about every item in the game

Hey terra
Man... last night was the fastest I think I've ever uninstalled Apex Legends
8 or 9 games and then booted.
You’ve done it more then once?
Yup, lol
Always for some reason or another.  But now it's heading into territories of "until they change X, i'm done" :P

First time was because my old PC wasn't powerful enough to run it playable-y.  2nd time I think was because I was worried about how much time I was spending.  Third time same reason (I seriously binged this game those two times)
Fourth time (with a resolve to limit play times) was because of a no-reg issue.  And this time I was checking out if they changed how Treasure Packs worked.
I like shooters.  But F2P ones have... questionable monetization and they can change drastically.
But the ones you pay up front for have a habit of releasing new entries like clockwork
I like building games, I love City Skylines, love Minecraft, I like brick rigs. Also sometimes StormWorks
I LOVE BeamNG too
More or less, I've noticed how heavily games are trying to retain your attention
WoW has gone too hard in this direction (and the subs for retail WoW reflect this), and Shadowlands might seriously be the last straw I have for this game.
I don’t like fighting games much
Not my style
Used to be studios were super happy if you purchased the game and enjoyed it so much that you bought the next entry and w/e dlc they put out
I used to play Fortnite on Playground sometimes but even that wasn’t actually I fighting game
Well, fighting area I should say
:ptv-uneasy:
Fortnite's a cool game, but the building mechanic, while being its greatest asset, is also its biggest weakness
There's such a high skill cap that if you joined later in the game's life, you're going to be DESTROYED by more experienced players.
Doesn't matter if you're a god at FPS games, Fortnite's building mechanics seriously dictate the flow of combat.

I do like the building tho...
That’s about all I like about it
There have been games when I was attempting ranked where I could easily beat people in a firefight, but would lose because they were the better builders
